dinogame

Class DinoPlayer

  • java.lang.Object
    • dinogame.DinoPlayer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.util.EventListener

    public class DinoPlayer
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver
    This is the player class. This class uses two sprites to convey the dinosaur running. Stays at the same x, but can jump and duck around obstacles.
    Version:
    Summer 2018.
    Author:
    kennemat

      • DinoPlayer

        public DinoPlayer()
        Constructor for the DinoPlayer class. Initializes variables, then starts the swing timer.

    • Method Detail

      • pressed

        public void pressed(int key)
        Called when a key is pressed. Determines if the key was the up key, down key, or space key.
        Parameters:
        key - The key that was pressed.

      • released

        public void released(int key)
        Called when a key is released. Determines if the key was the down key.
        Parameters:
        key - The key that was released.

      • paint

        public void paint(java.awt.Graphics g,
                  boolean switchLegs,
                  boolean dead)
        Repaints the player object. The logic for this is as follows: Checks if the player died. If so, paint dead player image, return. Checks if player is jumping. If so, paint player jumping, return. Checks if boolean to determine leg swap should switch. Checks if player is ducking. If so, duck according to currPic bool, return. Lastly, if still in the method, just paint the dino according to the currPic bool.
        Parameters:
        g - The graphics passed.
        switchLegs - determines if legs should be switched.
        dead - Determines if the player is dead.

      • imageUpdate

        public boolean imageUpdate(java.awt.Image img,
                           int infoflags,
                           int x,
                           int y,
                           int width,
                           int height)
        Inherited from ImageObserver. Does nothing here.
        Specified by:
        imageUpdate in interface java.awt.image.ImageObserver
        Parameters:
        img - The image updated.
        infoflags - Information flags.
        x - The x position of the image.
        y - The y position of the image.
        width - The width of the image.
        height - The height of the image.
        Returns:
        True if further updates needed, false if not,

      • actionPerformed

        public void actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent e)
        Inherited from ActionListener. This is what the swing timer calls every given number of milliseconds. The method checks whether the player is jumping. If so, will continue to decrease the jumpSpeed by the value of gravity, until the player has reached ground level again.
        Specified by:
        actionPerformed in interface java.awt.event.ActionListener
        Parameters:
        e - The action event that occured.

      • getY

        public int getY()
        Returns the current y value of the dino. If the dino is ducking, the y value needs to be skewed lower, as the y value is actually above the sprite for some reason.
        Returns:
        The current y position of the dino.

      • getWidth

        public int getWidth()
        Returns the width of the dino, according to whether the player is ducking or not.
        Returns:
        Width of the dino.

      • getHeight

        public int getHeight()
        Returns the height of the dino, according to whether the player is ducking or not.
        Returns:
        Width of the dino.
